Welcome to Rangia Teacher Training College

Rangia Teacher Training College would like to take this opportunity to welcome you to the pioneer institute of pre-service and in-service teacher education in the north-eastern region.

Rangia T. T. College was established in the year 1987 by the local people of Rangia Sub-Division under the district of Kamrup. The college was permitted by Gauhati University in 1991 and then was affiliated from the session 1993-94. It was recognized by ERC-NCTE in the year 2004. The Govt. of Assam accorded concurrence to this college in the year 2010.

MESSAGE FROM THE PRINCIPAL

Dr. Partha Phukan Mahanta

M.Sc. (Maths), M.Ed., Ph.D. (GU)

I take this opportunity to welcome you to Rangia Teacher Training College, the pioneer institute of teacher education in the north-eastern region.

read more‚Ä¶.

WELCOME TO RANGIA TEACHER TRAINING COLLEGE

Rangia T. T. College has produced a large number of B. Ed. degree holders for the last thirty years. Two-year B.Ed. course was introduced from the session 2015-16. Statistics of last five batches of candidates have been given. The column diagrams of various data have also been displayed. Rangia Teacher Training College (RTTC), situated at historically renowned place Randia-Rangia, is one of the premier institutions of teacher education not only in Assam but also in whole of India. The college has been catering teacher education by offering B. Ed. Degree since its establishment in 1987. Moreover since, 2020-21 the institution has been offering B.A. course for the students seeking both honours & regular course.

Alumni Placement Record

We are collecting data from our pass out students for making a database of our all alumni. So, all of our ex- student-teachers are requested to fill-in the simple online form linked herewith. We are shortly publishing a booklet of placement record of all our alumni.

Grievance Redressal Mechanism

Our Grievance system is designed to look into the complaints lodged by any student and redress them ASAP. The students can state their grievances regarding any academic and non-academic matters that occurred in the college grievance form/ suggestion box.
